i feel like tier 1 and 2 runes are simply an Influence points wasting trap for noobies, and now they can never be rid of their useless tier 1 and 2 runes, forever a scorn on their account, haunting them for silly purchases, but maybe that is just me? i waited until lv 20 to buy tier 3 off the get go, and would recommend that, so much IP to spend, and you know what you are doing by then. i would suggest a rune selling option, for half their worth in IP or something. i dunno, riot knows best.

One thing I have to mention, not sure if it directly links with runes is, that the new jungle "may" be a bit too hard on those that don't have T3 runes. Every game whenever I go jungle and clear Blue Golem, Wolves and then Birds; I either die or have to recall. Or sometimes I have to reacall right after wolves, depending on who I play and the leash. This applies to Toad --> Blue --> Wolves --> Birds. Vice versa, Golems --> Red --> Birds --> Wolves. I don't believe that there is enough opputunity for people like me, who don't have proper runes yet, to experience a proper game of jungling without being laid back early (e.g. no ganking, execution :( , being counter jungled and etc.). Please fix this issue Riot, because I find jungling a role where no one instalocks.

Can you use Team Builder before 30? I highly recommend that mode, it allows much better team compositions and much less fighting over role which makes the game a lot nicer.

As for jungling, if you're having trouble then take sustain junglers like Fiddlesticks. Fiddles doesn't really matter what runes you take, just start W, point in E, W, Q, W, R, W. Max R > W > Q > E, and you'll be fine. Start Blue of course, take whatever smite modification item you want, slow is nice, build a revolver, upgrade smite mod into the AP item. You'll be fine.

Warwick is good too, take attack speed runes, mix of armour/health yellows, cool down blues, mix of armour and attack speed quints. His passive means AS is pretty powerful. Start blue, go toad, doesn't matter if you don't get red but see if someone can ward it anyway.

Junglers like that are nice in the new jungle.
try going toad > blue > wolves > red > golems > b and get smite upgrade > back to toad for normal path, skip birds first round unless heav sustain champ
Leave a comment{go {champion:421}} and u win life

This is dumb. ALL THEY NEED TO DO IS THIS. A Tier 3 Rune costs, say, 600 IP (for the sake of this scenario). The Tier 1 Rune for that type then costs 1/3rd of that (200 IP) and the Tier 2 Rune for that type then costs 2/3rds of the Tier 3 cost (400 IP). When a player wants to get Tier 3 runes, all they should have to do is combine the Tier 1 and 2 Runes of that type, or pay the difference (i.e. Tier 1 --> 3 = Pay 400 IP, Tier 2 --> 3 = Pay 200 IP, Tier 1 + Tier 2 = Tier 3).

SIMPLE. And Riot could then just keep Tier 1 and 2 Runes as they are and just change how the combiner works.

Disregard all tier 1 and 2 runes. Nobody wants them and nobody benefits from having them left over. I think think they should remove the tiers all together and have one set of runes available from level 1. New players have trouble grasping the concept of runes anyway and they will probably just buy them when they feel ready. The only thing I got out of tier 1 and 2 runes was regret.
But I don't have any tier 1,2 runes just tier 3s so so what will happen then?
